meanings.definition: To beat or strike with a flail or similar tool.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was threaping the wheat to separate the grains.
meanings.sent2: She threaped the rug to remove the dust.
meanings.sent3: The children were threaping the pinata at the party.
meanings.sent4: The storm was threaping the trees with its strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith was threaping the metal to shape it into a sword.

meanings.definition: To separate grain from straw by beating.
meanings.sent1: The old method of threaping involved using a flail.
meanings.sent2: The farmer threaped the wheat to prepare it for milling.
meanings.sent3: The chef was threaping the herbs to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The wind was threaping the leaves from the trees in the autumn.
meanings.sent5: She was threaping the chaff from the wheat with a swift motion.

meanings.definition: To criticize severely or rebuke harshly.
meanings.sent1: The teacher threaped the student for not completing the assignment.
meanings.sent2: He felt embarrassed when his boss threaped him in front of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be threaping the dog for making a mess in the house.
meanings.sent4: The judge threaped the defendant for their reckless behavior.
meanings.sent5: She was threaping herself for not studying enough for the exam.
